text:
<@U05LT5S9SRJ>, there's also the possibility to create theme sections with custom classes.
This way you could add a background color AND image to a section using CSS.

This method works 100%, the only incovenience being that you may have to create a great number of sections depending on your design constraints and there's also no way to recognise a custom section from one that is standard when editing a page (apart from the specific design of the section)
See the paragraph about section classes.
Hello guys and gals, is it possible to get all the possible/available options of a choice field in HubL? One would think something like {{ module.choice_field.choices }} would work, but nope.

Hi, is it possible to get the label of dropdown option in HubL?  We added category dropdown to our products and the only thing I get there is the internal value (what can't be changed after creating), but I rather want to have the label related to this internal value. Any ideas how I could solve this? Thank you very much!!
thanks <@U02JH23B6T1> thatâ€™s what I ended up doing
Hi! Can you make a repetitive table? Like the possibility of certain entries could be 1 line of text, check, x or 2 lines of text in different font weight?
